headline: Oracle AI Agents Help Supply Chain Leaders Boost Efficiency and Strengthen Resiliency
summary: Oracle AI World Tour -- Oracle today announced new AI agents within Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications to help supply chain leaders accelerate decision-making and drive greater efficiency across planning, procurement, manufacturing, maintenance, and logistics. Built using Oracle AI Agent Studio for Fusion Applications, the new AI agents are embedded within supply chain processes to help leaders unlock productivity gains and enhance business performance by automating end-to-end workflows and delive

headline: Oracle Helps Organizations Enhance Process Manufacturing
summary: Oracle AI World -- Oracle today announced new capabilities in Oracle Fusion Cloud Supply Chain & Manufacturing (SCM) to help organizations manage the unique requirements of process manufacturing. The latest innovations help organizations that produce goods by mixing or blending ingredients improve real-time production visibility and meet regulatory requirements by connecting formulas, recipes, materials, and batch execution in a unified cloud solution.

content.title: Oracle Helps Organizations Enhance Process Manufacturing
content.summary: Oracle AI World -- Oracle today announced new capabilities in Oracle Fusion Cloud Supply Chain & Manufacturing (SCM) to help organizations manage the unique requirements of process manufacturing. The latest innovations help organizations that produce goods by mixing or blending ingredients improve real-time production visibility and meet regulatory requirements by connecting formulas, recipes, materials, and batch execution in a unified cloud solution.

headline: Oracle AI Agents Help Marketing, Sales, and Service Leaders Enhance Customer Experiences
summary: Oracle AI World Tour -- Oracle today announced new role-based AI agents within Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications to help organizations deliver intelligent customer experiences (CX) at scale. Built using Oracle AI Agent Studio for Fusion Applications, the new AI agents are embedded within marketing, sales, and service processes to help CX leaders drive productivity gains and enhance business performance by analyzing unified data, automating processes, and delivering predictive insights.

content.title: Oracle AI Agents Help Marketing, Sales, and Service Leaders Enhance Customer Experiences
content.summary: Oracle AI World Tour -- Oracle today announced new role-based AI agents within Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications to help organizations deliver intelligent customer experiences (CX) at scale. Built using Oracle AI Agent Studio for Fusion Applications, the new AI agents are embedded within marketing, sales, and service processes to help CX leaders drive productivity gains and enhance business performance by analyzing unified data, automating processes, and delivering predictive insights.

summary: U.S. stock markets have been struggling to break out of their recent plateau, with the  still largely unchanged over the past month as a healthier level of gains from sectors beyond tech limits gains for the benchmark and weighs on overall performance.  “For the broader market to make sustainable progress, renewed tech participation will likely be essential,” Turquist said.

headline: Azul 2026 State of Java Survey & Report: 62% of Enterprises Now Leverage Java to Power AI Functionality, 41% Rely on High-Performance Java Platforms to Reduce Cloud Compute Costs
summary: SUNNYVALE, Calif., February 10, 2026--Azul, the only company 100% focused on Java, today announced the results of its 2026 State of Java Survey & Report. The annual study, based on responses from more than 2,000 Java professionals worldwide, reveals a dual trend shaping the enterprise landscape: a strategic pivot toward using Java as a foundational language for AI development, and an acceleration in the growing migration away from Oracle Java due to pricing and licensing concerns.

content.title: Azul 2026 State of Java Survey & Report: 62% of Enterprises Now Leverage Java to Power AI Functionality, 41% Rely on High-Performance Java Platforms to Reduce Cloud Compute Costs
content.summary: SUNNYVALE, Calif., February 10, 2026--Azul, the only company 100% focused on Java, today announced the results of its 2026 State of Java Survey & Report. The annual study, based on responses from more than 2,000 Java professionals worldwide, reveals a dual trend shaping the enterprise landscape: a strategic pivot toward using Java as a foundational language for AI development, and an acceleration in the growing migration away from Oracle Java due to pricing and licensing concerns.

headline: Appficiency Inc. Announces Strategic Investment from Canadian Business Growth Fund to Accelerate Expansion
summary: TORONTO, February 10, 2026--Appficiency Inc. ("Appficiency"), a global IT consulting firm and software business delivering AI-powered enterprise digital transformation services, today announced it has received a minority equity investment from Canadian Business Growth Fund ("CBGF"). The investment represents a major milestone in Appficiency’s growth journey and will fuel AI innovation and expanded capabilities to serve enterprise clients across multiple platforms.

content.title: Appficiency Inc. Announces Strategic Investment from Canadian Business Growth Fund to Accelerate Expansion
content.summary: TORONTO, February 10, 2026--Appficiency Inc. ("Appficiency"), a global IT consulting firm and software business delivering AI-powered enterprise digital transformation services, today announced it has received a minority equity investment from Canadian Business Growth Fund ("CBGF"). The investment represents a major milestone in Appficiency’s growth journey and will fuel AI innovation and expanded capabilities to serve enterprise clients across multiple platforms.

headline: With European Deals, Alphabet Raises Bond Haul to $31.5 Billion
summary: Google owner Alphabet is raising about $11.5 billion by selling bonds in British pounds and Swiss francs, as it rounds up funding for a mammoth AI buildout.  Taken together with the $20 billion of dollar debt it issued Monday, it has secured $31.5 billion this week—eclipsing a $25 billion issue by rival "hyperscaler" Oracle about a week ago.  It raised the equivalent of $4 billion in Swiss francs, again through bonds with five different maturities.

content.title: With European Deals, Alphabet Raises Bond Haul to $31.5 Billion
content.summary: Google owner Alphabet is raising about $11.5 billion by selling bonds in British pounds and Swiss francs, as it rounds up funding for a mammoth AI buildout.  Taken together with the $20 billion of dollar debt it issued Monday, it has secured $31.5 billion this week—eclipsing a $25 billion issue by rival "hyperscaler" Oracle about a week ago.  It raised the equivalent of $4 billion in Swiss francs, again through bonds with five different maturities.

summary: U.S. stock markets have been struggling to break out of their recent plateau, with the  still largely unchanged over the past month as a healthier level of gains from sectors beyond tech limits gains for the benchmark and weighs on overall performance.  “For the broader market to make sustainable progress, renewed tech participation will likely be essential,” Turquist said.
